Ask HN: I'm building a small library for my team. Which books should it have?
text:
I work as the team lead of a QA team and I wanted to create a small library for people in my team - and others', of course - to expand their knowledge outside the technical domain (so, no language reference books, programming cookbooks, etc.).

As an example, I was thinking of adding "The Ideal Team Player" by Lencioni, which I found useful to use as a loose framework when hiring people.

What are your "must-read" books that I should put on this bookshelf?

Thanks!

Ask HN: Contingency plans for a lead dev no longer avail?
text:
What are typical ways larger projects handle a situation where a person closely associated to the project is no longer available?

For example, Linus for Linux, or Guido for Python, if they were suddenly and unexpectedly unable to perform their duties.

Ask HN: Can AI research still be done well in universities nowadays?
text:
It seems that most major AI breakthroughs are coming out of companies with the huge amounts of computing power required for learning large models.

So how do universities cope in this environment?
